PACC::Socket::AddressPortable network address
PACC::SVG::AttributeContainer for a single style attribute.An attribute is a pair of name/value strings. Its only constructor is protected in order to restrict its usage. It will be sub-classed for specific SVG style attributes
PACC::XML::AttributeListAttribute list for tree nodes
PACC::Socket::CafeCafe protocol
PACC::SVG::CanvasSpecialized document to display on-screen graphics.A canvas opens a TCP/IP connection with a running viewer user agent on the network. By default it connects to the localhost at port 61250
PACC::SVG::CircleGraphic primitive for circles
PACC::SVG::ClosePathPath command to close the current subpath.This command close the subpath by drawing a straight line from the current point to current subpath's initial point

PACC::SVG::FrameGraphic primitive container with a clipping rectangle.The frame is a group that implements a clipping rectangle for its elements. Coordinates for elements inside the frame are relative to the frame origin
PACC::SVG::GrayColor as a shade of gray
PACC::SVG::GroupBasic graphic primitive container.A group holds an ordered list of graphic primitives with default style and transform. The group style and transform applies to all embedded elements that do not define their own. Groups can also be nested

Richard J. Wagner, v1.0 15 May 2003 <rjwagner@writeme.com>

PACC::SVG::PathGraphic primitive for paths
PACC::SVG::PathDataData defining a path.This is the base class for path commands. It is not possible to create an instance of this class directly. Instead you should use one of the subclasses that provide real functionalities
PACC::SVG::PointPosition (x,y) of a graphic component
PACC::SVG::PointListList of points.This class is a standard vector of point (std::vector<Point>) with some utility functions and + and += operators to facilitate the concatenation of point lists

PACC::Socket::PortPortable socket base class
PACC::SVG::PrimitiveBase class for graphic elements.This class provide no more functionality than it's base class. It is intended to be able to distinguish graphics element from others. That way we can restrict at compile time what kind of elements can be inserted in a Group for example
